alert.note: Alert for Meigs (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 4:14PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Meigs, northeastern Mason and northwestern Jackson Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 413 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles east of Point Pleasant, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ripley, Racine, Ravenswood, New Haven, Syracuse, Hartford City, Cottageville, Portland, Mount Alto, Evans and Letart. This includes Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 136 and 146. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
